answers.answer: Hi there!Though not something to be ‘very’ concerned about, this is something to be concerned about. Protein in urine could be due to a few conditions, most of them affecting the kidneys primarily, and would need to be managed effectively to avoid complications. I would suggest an evaluation by a primary care pediatrician or a pediatric nephrologist immediately for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate management.Hope this is helpful.Take care!

question: Is this something to be very concerned about?
title: My son has type 1 diabetes,and he has protein in his urine.
